name: Baingan Bharta
history: Baingan Bharta is a popular dish in various regions of India, particularly in Punjab. It's a vegetarian dish made with roasted eggplants, mashed and cooked with spices.
description: Baingan Bharta is a smoky, spiced, mashed eggplant dish. The eggplants are roasted to infuse a smoky flavor, then mashed and cooked with onions, tomatoes, and a variety of aromatic Indian spices.

instructions.title: Roast the Eggplant
instructions.description: Roast the eggplant over an open flame or in an oven until the skin is charred and the inside is tender. Allow to cool, peel, and mash the flesh.

instructions.title: Prepare the Masala
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. SautÃ© until onions are golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to the onions. Cook for a minute, then add tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Combine with Eggplant
instructions.description: Add the mashed eggplant to the pan. Mix well with the masala and cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala over the mixture and cook for another minute.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or naan.

tips: Ensure the eggplant is completely roasted to develop a smoky flavor.
Adjust the amount of green chilies and red chili powder to suit your spice preference.
variations: Add peas or cubed potatoes for additional texture.
Substitute eggplant with zucchini for a different version.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Accompany with a side of cucumber raita or salad.
